data.title: Yolanda Maria Farrow on LinkedIn: Why You Should Work Less and Spend More Time on Hobbies

ğŸ— ğŸ’¡ âš¡ Brobston Fashion News Brief for Friday, May 3rd Pandora Pandora has raised its 2024 revenue guidance following an 18 percent organic growth in the first fiscal quarter, reflecting the jeweler's successful penetration of the demi-fine jewelry market and the growth of its collections beyond the charm bracelet. Chanel Chanel hosted a cruise show on the rooftop of the CitÃ© Radieuse in Marseille, aiming to captivate a new generation of consumers by venturing into unexpected destinations, a move underlining the brandâ€™s evolution while maintaining its iconic essence. Hugo Boss Hugo Boss reported a first-quarter sales increase of 6 percent, fueled by the launch of its denim collection and high-profile marketing campaigns, although indicating a slowdown in growth compared to the previous year's record-breaking sales. Safilo and David Beckham Safilo and David Beckham have entered into a groundbreaking perpetual eyewear license agreement, highlighting a strategic move within the eyewear industry and emphasizing the brand's aim for long-term growth and global market penetration. Puig Ahead of its initial public offering, Puig unveiled a new corporate logo and brand identity to signify a new chapter for the 110-year-old beauty and fashion company, reflecting its long-term vision and commitment to creativity and brand storytelling. Christian Louboutin and Pierre Yovanovitch Christian Louboutin collaborated with designer Pierre Yovanovitch on a unique chair collection, blending Louboutin's iconic shoe design with Yovanovitch's architectural expertise, marking an innovative fusion of high fashion and home decor. So far, the luxury slowdown has followed a pattern: Stalwarts of top-end, logo-free fashion like HermÃ¨s, Zegna and Brunello Cucinelli have surged ahead in recent months while brands dependent on fashion-driven, entry-level luxuries, from Burberry to Keringâ€™s Gucci and BALENCIAGA, struggled. Last weekâ€™s sales were no different. HermÃ¨s outperformed expectations as enthusiasm for its iconic Kelly and Birkin bags continues to mount, with many customers willing to buy deeply into the brand across categories. Ultra-luxe, so-called â€œquiet luxuryâ€ propositions outperformed for Italian companies, too: Zegnaâ€™s first-quarter sales climbed by 11 percent while Brunello Cucinelli surged 18 percent, defying predictions for a slowdown across the market. Meanwhile, Kering confirmed its forecast for a 10 percent year-on-year drop in first-quarter sales, and warned investors first-half profits would likely fall by 40 to 45 percent. â€œGucci is not in the sweet spot for positioning â€” itâ€™s seen as not enough high-end, not enough affordable,â€ chief financial officer Armelle Poulou said. 8 Soft Skills of Top Performers High performers are people who reach their goals and are invaluable to the businesses they work for. They are viewed as responsible, reliable, and talented. High performers go above their role to meet their goals and complete work tasks. Top-performing employees take the initiative to assist their company by improving their behavior and habits. High-performing employees also tend to possess certain characteristics that set them apart from other workers: ğŸ‘ Give this post a thumbs up â• Follow me for more Tips Credit Will McTighe #softskills #highperformers #emotionalintelligence #resilience #adaptability #dependability
